info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 27 at 7:10AM CDT until March 27 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Brownsville TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following counties, Cameron, Hidalgo and Willacy.
* WHEN...Until 800 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 710 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harlingen, San Benito, Mercedes, La Feria, Santa Rosa, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Los Indios, Rangerville, Santa Maria, Sebastian, Primera, Combes, Palm Valley Police Department, Doctor Hesiquio Rodriguez Elementary School, Moises Vela Middle School, Wilson Elementary School, Harlingen High School South, Lamar Elementary School and Harlingen City Reservoir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Cameron, TX; Hidalgo, TX; Willacy, TX
